results.title: Happy Gilmore
results.creator_credit: Dennis Dugan, Robert Simonds, MCA/Universal and MCA/Universal Home Video
results.brief_description: Happy Gilmore has an anger management problem, which could be really helpful if he could achieve his dream of becoming a professional ice hockey player. However he is a lousy skater. When his beloved grandmother loses her home to the IRS he desperately tries to find a way to raise the money. Quite by accident he discovers that his hockey slap shot translates to an amazingly accurate 400 yard golf tee shot. So he decides to join the pro golf tour, brining his ferocious temper and outlandish antics to the well-tended fairways. Before long he is a media sensation, attracting hordes of followers and news cameras wherever he goes. A rivalry between Happy and nasty golf pro ‘Shooter’ heats up, resulting in a riotous confrontation on the once-hallowed golf links.

results.title: Joe Dirt
results.creator_credit: Dennie Gordon, Robert Simonds, Columbia Pictures and Happy Madison Productions
results.brief_description: Joe Dirt (David Spade) is a janitor, has a ‘mullet’ hairstyle and is the butt of many jokes in the building where he works. Abandoned as a child at the Grand Canyon by his birth parents, Joe is raised by foster parents, until he makes the decision to find his family and ask them why they left him behind. When he is discovered by a radio DJ (Dennis Miller) in Los Angeles, Joe goes live on air and shares the adventures he had while searching for his parents with the listeners, captivating the entire city. Cast also includes Christopher Walken, Brittany Daniel, Kid Rock and Jaime Pressley.

results.title: White man's country
results.creator_credit: Anthony Howarth, David Kopp, Anthony-David Productions and Films Incorporated
results.brief_description: This is a well-documented film which deals with British Colonialism in Kenya from an African viewpoint. This film works as an expose of colonialists, and can be used to study them, or as part of an African history course.

results.title: Gladiator [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Ridley Scott, Branko Lustig, David Franzoni, Douglas Wick, NBCUniversal and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Russell Crowe stars as Maximus, a former general accused of murdering Roman Emperor Marcus Aurelius. Maximus is forced to become a gladiator, and uses his newfound fame and power to extract revenge.

constellations_other.name: Swords, sandals and lightning bolts
constellations_other.description: In Thor: Love and Thunder, Russell Crowe plays one of the most recogniseable gods in the pantheon – Zeus. His scenes lampoon his Oscar-winning role in Gladiator, one of the most recognised films in a classic genre.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Ridley Scott, Branko Lustig, David Franzoni, Douglas Wick, NBCUniversal and Universal Pictures
results.description: Following the suspicious death of Roman Emperor Marcus Aurelius, his newly named successor, Maximus (Russell Crowe) - the former emperor’s key advisor and most loyal general, is accused of his murder, leaving Marcus’ scheming son, Commodus (Joaquin Phoenix) to take over the throne. As a result of his accusation, Maximus is stripped of his title and position in the army and sold to slave traders, forced to become a gladiator - men trained to fight to the death as entertainment for a paying audience. Using his new fame and power he vows to fight the man responsible for his dishonour. Includes the making of documentary. Cast also includes Connie Nielsen, Derek Jacobi, Richard Harris and Oliver Reed in his final screen role (Reed died before the movie was completed). Awards: winner of 5 Academy Awards including Best Actor (Russell Crowe) and Best Film (2000).

results.title: The Mask of Zorro
results.creator_credit: Martin Campbell, David Fister, Doug Claybourne and Tri-Star Pictures
results.brief_description: From the director of “Goldeneye” comes this swashbuckling action-packed blockbuster starring Anthony Hopkins, Antonio Banderas and Catherine Zeta Jones. Zorro -legendary name conjures up images of masks, sword fights and one man’s fight for justice. Or is it just one man? Set in California when it’s still controlled from Spain by the Mexican authorities, one man (Anthony Hopkins) fights against injustice for the ordinary man in the only way he can - as a masked phantom. What happens when his world is turned upside down? Does the legend continue and how is this possible? These questions and others are answered as the story unfolds.

results.title: Mystery, Alaska
results.creator_credit: Jay Roach, David E. Kelley, Howard Baldwin and Buena Vista
results.brief_description: Mystery, Alaska is a small town where all the men in the community are obsessed with ice-hockey. They have their own competitive league which becomes the attention of a national sports magazine, this leads to someone at the National Hockey League coming up with an idea for an amazing publicity stunt. The New York Rangers are on their way to Mystery to play the local boys in an ice-hockey match. The town goes crazy with excitement, although there a few who that don’t see this as a good idea, more like an opportunity to embarrass their close knit community.

results.title: The Sopranos. Season 4
results.creator_credit: Alan Taylor, Allen Coulter, Daniel Attias, Henry J. Bronchtein, Jack Bender, James Hayman, John Patterson, Steve Buscemi, Tim Van Patten, David Chase, Ilene Landress, Brad Grey Television, Chase Films and Home Box Office
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Sopranos”.
Season four of this award-winning television series created by David Chase. The dark exploration of masculinity, abuse and violence which is central to this series exemplifies what is unique to The Sopranos: terrific writing, outstanding performances and a daring audacity to fully explore the brutality of contemporary culture in the US. The mores and ethics of organised crime seem an apt metaphor for the capitalist system. Ep 1 “For all debts public and private” Tony tries to raise cash for investments, whilst Carmela pushes for traditional insurance. Uncle Junior frets about his impending trial. Ep 2 “No show” With Paulie behind bars, Christopher is assigned his turf. Meadow considers taking a year off college. Ep 3 “Christopher” The first Soprano trial in 16 years commences; Italian pride causes an array of troubles. Ep 4 “The Weight” Johnny Sack embarks on a bloody vendetta; Carmela develops a close relationship with Furio, encountering Tony problems. Ep 5 “Pie o my” Carmela and Tony continue to disagree over the finances; Uncle Junior faces problems in court. Ep 6 “Everybody hurts” Tony gives greater responsibility to Christopher; Meadow joins the right side of the law. Ep 7 “Watching too much television” Tony and the gang throw a release-party for Paulie. Furio finds himself attracted to Carmela. Ep 8 “Mergers & acquisitions” Tony meets an attractive art dealer; Paulie tries to integrate his mother into her nursing home; Carmela discovers a new source of income. Ep 9 “Whoever did this” Uncle Junior develops a new defence strategy; Tony brings Svetlana back into their lives; tragedy strikes Ralph’s son. Ep 10 “The Strong, silent type” Tony tracks down Ralph; Furio struggles with his feelings for Carmela; Christopher’s heroin addiction turns catastrophic. Ep 11 “Calling all cars” Dreams persue Tony through the night; Tony contemplates business decisions; Dr Melfi works on the undercurrents of Tony’s dreams but he wants out. Ep 12 “Eloise” Tony haggles over profits; Paulie’s loyalty is called into question. Ep 13 “Whitecaps” Tony battles to keep the family together.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alan Taylor, Allen Coulter, Daniel Attias, Henry J. Bronchtein, Jack Bender, James Hayman, John Patterson, Steve Buscemi, Tim Van Patten, David Chase, Ilene Landress, Brad Grey Television, Chase Films and Home Box Office

results.title: The Sopranos. Season 3 [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Allen Coulter, Daniel Attias, Henry J. Bronchtein, Jack Bender, John Patterson, Steve Buscemi, Tim Van Patten, David Chase, Ilene Landress, Brad Grey Television, Chase Films and Home Box Office
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Sopranos”.
The third season of this award-winning television series finds the Soprano family going about their business unaware that the FBI have begun a covert surveillance of their every move. But as the series progresses, the ever watchful eye of the Feds becomes less important than the personal experiences of the New Jersey crime family. Tony Soprano (James Gandolfini) is still in therapy and though he is still baiting psychoanalyst Dr. Melfi (Lorraine Bracco), he is getting closer to understanding the source of his anxiety attacks: they are triggered by memories of his violent childhood. But with the death of his mother, Livia (Nancy Marchand), Tony has to deal with the twin demons of rage and guilt. Tony also has to deal with his daughter Meadow’s awakening sexuality (including her falling in love with a black man) as well as with the spiritual angst of his wife, Carmella (Edie Falco), who is increasingly disturbed by the ethical implications of her being a partner to a mobster. It’s only when he meets the beautiful Gloria (Annabella Sciorra) that things start looking up for Tony, but soon, in true Soprano’s style, her emotional instability creates a dangerous domestic situation for him. Outstanding episodes in this series include “Employee of the month”, which deals with the rape of Dr. Melfi, the black comedy of “Pine barrens”, directed by Steve Buscemi, and the horrifying violence of “University” which features the abusive relationship between a mobster and one of the strippers at the Bada Bing. The dark exploration of masculinity, abuse and violence which is central to this episode exemplifies what is unique to The Sopranos: terrific writing, outstanding performances and a daring audacity to fully explore the brutality of contemporary culture. The mores and ethics of organised crime seem an apt metaphor for the contemporary world.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Allen Coulter, Daniel Attias, Henry J. Bronchtein, Jack Bender, John Patterson, Steve Buscemi, Tim Van Patten, David Chase, Ilene Landress, Brad Grey Television, Chase Films and Home Box Office

results.title: The Sopranos. Season 2 [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Allen Coulter, Henry J. Bronchtein, John Patterson, Lee Tamahori, Martin Bruestle, Tim Van Patten, Ilene Landress, Brillstein-Grey Entertainment, Chase Films and Home Box Office
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Sopranos”.
In the second series of the outstanding television series about the day to day realities of a New Jersey Mafia family, we find that Tony Soprano (James Gandolfini) is still prone to bouts of existential despair while at the same time having to be the boss-man of an organised crime family. While dealing with the running of his myriad operations Tony also has to keep the facts of his adulterous affairs from his suspicious wife, Carmella (Edie Falco) and make sure that his increasingly rebellious children don’t undermine him. It is one of the major achievements of the series that though the criminal and violent world it portrays is specific, unique and tinged with the romanticism of Golden Age Hollywood representations of crime and gangsters, it nevertheless manages to make Tony’s ethical and psychological choices resonate with the everyday realities of the viewer’s life. In Series Two, Tony returns to his psychiatrist and also returns to the family home in Naples. This episode, “Commendatori” is a series highlight, revolving around the glaring discrepancies between the Italo-American conceptions of the “old country” and the realities of contemporary Europe. Other outstanding episodes in series two include “D-Girl” where Christopher (Michael Imperioli) finds hidden talents as an actor and “Knight in white satin armour” where the tensions between Janie, Ritchie and Tony resolve in a violent and unexpected manner. But every episode in this adult cynical series is of excellent value.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Allen Coulter, Henry J. Bronchtein, John Patterson, Lee Tamahori, Martin Bruestle, Tim Van Patten, Ilene Landress, Brillstein-Grey Entertainment, Chase Films and Home Box Office

results.title: The Sopranos
results.creator_credit: Alan Taylor, Allen Coulter, Andy Wolk, Daniel Attias, David Chase, John Patterson, Lorraine Senna, Matthew Penn, Nick Gomez, Tim Van Patten, Ilene Landress, Brillstein-Grey Entertainment, Chase Films and Home Box Office
results.brief_description: Multi-Emmy Award winning series which brilliantly portrays the everyday lives of a New Jersey crime family. Tony Soprano (James Gandolfini), though ostensibly in the Waste Management business is really one of the heads of a large Mafia family. With a consistently brilliant cast, tough and witty writing and a complex examination of materialism and contemporary American society, “The Sopranos” manages to create an ambiguous moral epic out of its study of power, corruption and money. Violent and uncompromising, the series delivers a narrative sweep that has the breadth of the classical nineteenth century novel but its language, vision and cynicism plants it firmly in the twenty-first. Created by David Chase and featuring direction by noted independent directors such as Nick Gomez, “The Sopranos” deserves the acclaim heaped upon it. In its moral complexity, insight and daring it leaves the products of the Hollywood motion picture industry for dead.
